title: BBC Local Live: Nottinghamshire on Tuesday 20 December 2016 - BBC News
summary: inquest into husband and wife deaths adjourned .
council tax in nottingham rises next year .
notts county face peterborough in fa cup second round replay .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 wednesday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: our live updates have now ended and will return tomorrow from 08:00 .

documents.title: weather : dry start to the evening
text: a dry start this evening and at first tonight there will be clear spells .
however , cloud will increase later , the breeze will up and outbreaks of ( mostly ) light rain and drizzle will push southeastwards .
lows around 3c ( 39f ) .
author: Kay Crewdson
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: your photos : sun glows over attenborough
text: dave cook has sent in this lovely photo from attenborough nature reserve this afternoon .
do n't forget , you can email or message us on facebook with your photos if you have been out and about .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: the festive names keep coming in
text: here 's a suggestion from healthwatch notts .
what do you think ?
@ twitterid loving the notts festive place names can we throw `` arn-yule-d '' into the festive pot ?
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: man treated for injuries after m1 crash
text: a spokesman for the air ambulance has given us some details about the accident on the m1 southbound near leicestershire this afternoon .
he said the helicopter arrived on the scene at 12.55 and crews treated one male driver before helping east midlands ambulance get him to hospital .
the southbound carriageway between j21 and j20 is expected to stay shut until at least 20:30 tonight .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: notts boss gets five-game ban
text: it 's not been a great few days for notts manager john sheridan .
he 's now been handed a five-match touchline ban by the fa after he protested about wycombe 's second goal on 10 december .
the ban starts immediately which means he 'll have to watch tonight 's fa cup second-round replay against peterborough from the stands .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel : m1 southbound still shut after crash
text: as it stands , the m1 is not expected to be reopened until at least 8:30pm this evening to allow accident investigation to continue

documents.title: inquests adjourned until next year
text: the couple had been living separately at the time of their deaths .
earlier on friday , ms nagle 's son , nathan paton , 22 , was also badly injured after he told eye witnesses he 'd been attacked with a nail gun .
police said the three incidents were linked and they 're not looking for anyone else in connection with them .
senior coroner , dr robert hunter , adjourned the inquests until next year while police investigations continue .
author: Navtej Johal
East Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: inquest hears man died instantly on m1
text: an inquest has heard claire nagle , 38 , died in hospital on friday after being found seriously injured at her mother 's home in borrowash .
half an hour later her husband vincent , a heating engineer and plumber , died after he jumped from a bridge on the m1 near the trowell services and was hit by a lorry .
the inquest heard he died instantly .
author: Navtej Johal
East Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: nottingham prison officers investigated
text: an officer from nottingham prison has been arrested and seven others suspended from duty as police investigate `` conspiracy to cause actual bodily harm '' .
the sun has reported the prison officers allegedly goaded muslim inmates until they had to be restrained as part of a racist game .
a spokesman for nottinghamshire police said the alleged incidents happened `` some time ago '' and a 28-year-old man who was arrested has been bailed pending further inquiries .

documents.title: thieves rip out car park machines
text: police are investigating after a 4x4 vehicle was used to rip out five car park ticket machines in newark .
the thefts are thought to have happened on friday and saturday .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: m1 delays expected until 19:30 tonight
text: leicestershire police tweets
# m1closure | m1 s/bound j21 and j20 remains closed due to a serious collision .
normal traffic conditions are expected at approx .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : police close lane on clifton bridge
text: clifton brdige one lane blocked inbnd due to police incident

documents.title: inquest starts into death of husband and wife
text: an inquest into the death of a woman in borrowash , derbyshire and her husband on the m1 near nottinghamshire hears the provisional cause of death for claire nagle was `` pressure on neck '' , pending further tests .
author: Navtej Johal
East Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: can you come up with any better ?
text: here are just some of my favourite names that were sent in .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: getting creative with festive place names
text: after a train company asked passengers to rename its stations with a festive theme , bbc radio nottingham asked listeners this morning to come up with some festive alternatives to area names .
and you all came up trumps with some of the suggestions
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: baby born 16 weeks early goes home for christmas
text: it 's a happy story for little amaya , who is heading home from hospital this week - just in time for christmas .
she has spent her first eight months on a ward at the qmc after she was born 16 weeks early with a range of health problems .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: airport escapes £ 12.5m price-fixing fine
text: here 's more on the story that east midlands airport has escaped a £ 12.5m fine by admitting it fixed car park prices with a fellow parking provider .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel : m1 closed southbound after crash
text: the m1 was shut in both directions for a short time this afternoon so the air ambulance could land after a serious crash on the southbound carriageway .
# m1 northbound between j20 and j21 has re-opened .
m1 s/b remains closed between j21 # leicester and j20 # rugby.info

documents.title: weather : pleasant afternoon ahead
text: generally dry and fine with bright and sunny spells mixed in with some cloud .
highs of 6c ( 43f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: sprouts could be more expensive this year
text: farmer peter foster said the moths had come over to the uk from europe in big groups this summer and eaten away at a lot of the sprouts , which caused some of them to grow small and deformed - making them unsaleable .
he said the heavy rain in june at the start of the growing season also caused a big problem .
mr foster said they only had a third of the usual amount of sprouts this year so they would also be more expensive .
so make sure you get your sprouts in early !
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: it 's not been a good year for sprouts
text: love them or hate them , sprouts have n't had a good year .
here are the little green brassicas on the production line at a farm in rolleston but the diamondback moth and wet weather caused havoc this summer .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: sheridan knows notts job is precarious
text: there was a lot of talk yesterday about notts manager john sheridan 's future at the club - irrespective of who the new owners are .
sport has more on his interview after he told bbc nottingham he was `` worried '' about his position because of the team 's recent poor run .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: police investigation continues
text: nottinghamshire police said they were continuing to hunt for the person who fatally stabbed mr mazhar in june .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: man 's killer still at large
text: the men admitted their involvement in the stabbing of aqib mazhar from russell street , forest fields in june after his car was blocked by three other vehicles .
mobile phone footage played out during the hearing showed mr mazhar 's killer was a fifth person who is still on the run .

judge rafferty said to the defendants : `` the tragedy of this case is that all four of you know perfectly well who stabbed aqib , but you have done nothing to speak out to put aqib 's family at their ease . ''
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
text: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel : crash shuts lane on a1
text: one lane is closed on the a1 at markham moor because of an accident .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: four jailed for ambush stab killing
text: four men have been jailed for killing a 21-year-old by stabbing him in a car ambush in russell street , forest fields .
the four men , aged between 18 and 24 , from nottingham and derby , all pleaded guilty to manslaughter after their charges were changed from murder during a two-week trial .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: airport price fixing ' can not happen again '
text: ema have released this statement following the caa 's findings :
we are sorry that this situation occurred and have introduced procedures to ensure that this can not happen again .
as soon as we became aware of the issue in 2013 , we immediately informed the competition authorities and we have subsequently cooperated fully with their investigation .
the parking operator in question operated a small premium parking facility at east midlands airport between october 2007 and september 2012 .
we are committed to continuing to offer our customers the car parking services they want at highly competitive prices . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: consumers wo n't be taken for a ride , says caa
text: the caa said ema only avoided a fine because it had confessed to the fixing .
richard moriarty , markets and consumers director at the caa , said : `` this case should serve as a clear sign that we are prepared to take action to protect consumers wherever necessary .
`` companies should be well aware that they could face a significant fine if they break competition law . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: airport struck car park deal with no 'price undercutting '
text: ema struck a deal with prestige which meant the firm could only offer services if it did not undercut prices at ema 's car park .
the caa also found that the two companies shared information about car park prices , while ema `` actively monitored '' prestige 's prices .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: airport avoids 'price fixing ' fine
text: the owners of east midlands airport ( ema ) have avoided a £ 12.5m fine after it admitted it had fixed car park prices .
the civil aviation authority ( caa ) found ema had flouted competition law by fixing prices with prestige parking limited between october 2007 and september 2012 .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: some other festive favourites
text: nottingham games expert , rob burman , came into bbc nottingham with these games earlier .
i had n't heard of any of them but he said ticket to ride was a good alternative to monopoly , and while relatively unheard of , had sold millions worldwide .
kill doctor lucky might not sound very festive , but rob said it was similar to cluedo and another good one to play with the family .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: what games will you be playing this christmas ?
text: with only five days to christmas day you might have got the turkey and mulled wine ready , but do you know what board games you 're going to be opening ?
monopoly , charades and trivial pursuit are the usual favourites .
but what about some alternatives ?
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: teenager missing from home
text: have you seen 14-year-old sophie adenuga ?
police say they are concerned for her safety after she was reported missing from st ann 's at around 06:00 yesterday .
she had a purple suitcase with her .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: inquests open into borrowash deaths
text: inquests are due to open today into the deaths of a woman and her husband , who died within hours of each other .

claire nagle , 38 , died after being found with serious injuries in derbyshire on friday and her husband vincent , 44 , was killed after being hit by a lorry on the m1 near trowell services in nottinghamshire shortly afterwards .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: big night for notts
text: there 's a huge game for notts tonight .
they 're at peterborough for their fa cup second round replay and there 's a big prize at stake .
the winners will face current premier league leaders chelsea at stamford bridge .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: care business 'not making a profit '
text: clair shepherd , manager of midlands home care services , woodborough road , nottingham , backed the call for more than £ 16 per hour , saying at one time her company had been paid £ 12.20 by the city council and they were not making a profit .

she said : `` we are a small business and trying to accommodate as many packages as we can , and employ more staff , which we want to do but when when you are only getting paid £ 14 per hour that is not always possible . ''
author: Mike O'Sullivan
Reporter, East Midlands Today

documents.title: travel : eastwood road reopens
text: engine lane in eastwood has reopened after it was shut in both directions because of an accident earlier this morning .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
text: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: council was 'trying to get value for money '
text: council leader , graham chapman , said : `` we were getting quite good value for money but what has happened since is the minimum wage has been increased so we 've had to increase the amount .

`` the fact we were getting such good value for money was probably to our credit , but there 's a certain point that people can operate at that level of funding and we have to do something about it.. we have to pump more money in despite being cut by the government . ''
author: Mike O'Sullivan
Reporter, East Midlands Today

documents.title: weather for the east midlands
text: some misty and murky spots first thing this morning along with plenty of cloud .
however the cloud will break allowing for some sunny spells in the afternoon .
highs of 5c ( 41f ) .

documents.title: nottingham defends paying low price for social care
text: nottingham city council has defended paying what was the lowest price in the east midlands to companies providing social care in people 's own homes .
it said it was getting value for money when it paid £ 12.20 per hour in april and has since increased that by £ 3 per hour to help care firms , following a recent rise in the minimum wage .
the industry body says it currently needs £ 16.70 and claims some councils are failing to pay realistic rates .
but councillor graham chapman , deputy leader of the council , said the £ 12.20 rate showed they were trying to get value for money .
author: Mike O'Sullivan
Reporter, East Midlands Today

documents.title: women in hospital after bunny crash
text: two women were taken to hospital after a crash in bunny .
firefighters were called out to gotham lane in bunny late last night - cutting one of the injured from the wreckage .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: travel : crash shuts eastwood road
text: engine lane in eastwood is closed in both directions because of an accident .
the road is shut between the engine lane and moorgreen junctions .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: join us for today 's updates
text: good morning and welcome to tuesday 's updates .
after a week away from the office , i 'm ready to bring you all the news , travel , weather and sport for nottinghamshire .
have a great day all .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online
